# autocorrectMode

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether to allow Autocorrect during an assessment.

## Declaration

```swift
var autocorrectMode: AEAssessmentConfiguration.AutocorrectMode { get set }
```

## Discussion

Users can turn on autocorrect in the Settings app (General > Keyboard > Auto-Correction). An assessment session disables this feature by default, but you can allow it by setting [doc://com.apple.automaticassessmentconfiguration/documentation/AutomaticAssessmentConfiguration/AEAssessmentConfiguration/autocorrectMode-swift.property] in the [doc://com.apple.automaticassessmentconfiguration/documentation/AutomaticAssessmentConfiguration/AEAssessmentConfiguration] instance that you use to initialize a session. Set the mode’s value to some combination of the the values from the [doc://com.apple.automaticassessmentconfiguration/documentation/AutomaticAssessmentConfiguration/AEAssessmentConfiguration/AutocorrectMode-swift.struct] structure.

## Allowing corrections

- **allowsSpellCheck**: A Boolean value that indicates whether to allow spell check during an assessment.
- **AEAssessmentConfiguration.AutocorrectMode**: The set of autocorrect features that you can enable during an assessment.
